   How Does Recycling
 Help to Reduce Pollution

Introduce:
 Recycling is the process of turning old materials into new materials and items. It can help reduce pollution by saving on the cost of making new materials and reducing the number of pollutants that factories release into the air. Recycling is about more than just reducing air and water pollution. It also helps slow the greenhouse gases that cause global warming and helps protect the planet's resources. Recycling keeps waste out of landfills.

Four Benefits of Recycling:

  • Reduce the amount of waste sent to landfills and incinerators.

  • Protect natural resources, such as wood, water and minerals.

  • Reduce the need to collect new materials and prevent contamination, such as plastics.

  • To save energy.


    • Reference:
    How Can Recycling Help Prevent Pollution by Brenner, Laurie. 2 August 2021.
    Recycling Basics from U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.
